channel.title: Learn Mandarin in Mandarin with Huimin
channel.description:
大家好，我是惠敏。我是一個來自台灣的中文老師，我從2004年開始教中文，目前已經教了17年。我希望能透過簡單易懂的中文，跟大家分享我在生活中好玩的事情，一些想法，新聞，電影，還有學習語言的經驗和方法，希望你們的中文也會一起進步喔。

Hi, I am Huimin, a Mandarin instructor from Taiwan. I've been teaching Mandarin since 2004. I would like to share some thoughts, insights, things that I enjoy, like movies and books, and also my experiences of learning and teaching languages.
Meanwhile, I hope your Mandarin will be improved while following my podcast.

Powered by Firstory Hosting

item.title: #103. 看牙医 Go to the dentist (Level A2-B1)

14. 拍 x光pāi x guāng，take x-ray (shoot)
15. 防止辐射 fángzhǐ fúshè，protect against radiation (prevent radiation)
16. 度 360 dù，360 degrees (spend)
17. 处理 chǔlǐ ，deal with (deal with)
18. 机器 jīqì，machine (machine)
19. 一清二楚 yī qīng'èr chǔ，clear as day (clear)
20. 牙周病 yá zhōu bìng，periodontal disease (periodontal disease)
21. 蛀牙 zhùyá，tooth decay (tooth decay)
22. 刷牙 shuāyá，brush teeth (brush teeth)
23. 用牙线 yòng yá xiàn，floss (dental)
24. 清干净 qīng qiánjìng，clean it up (clean)

26. 钻牙机 zuān yá jī，dental drill (drilling machine)
27. 痠痛 suāntòng，sore (sore)

29. 举手 jǔ shǒu，raise your hand (hold a hand)

31. 唿吸 hūxī，breathe (suck)

34. 吸口水 xīkǒushuǐ，suck saliva (water absorption)
35. 流出来 liú chūlái，flow out (outflow)
36. 被口水噎到 bèi kǒu shuǐ yē dào，choked on saliva (delose to the saliva)
37. 拔牙 báyá，extract a tooth (extract a tooth)

item.title: #102. 终于学会游泳了Finally I can swim! (Level B1-B2)
item.description:
终于学会游泳了
生詞 vocabulary
2. 克服 kèfú(overcome)
3. 恐惧 kǒngjù(fear)

18. 离水面很近 lí shuǐmiàn hěn jìn(close to the water)
19. 呛到水 qiāng dào shuǐ(choked on water)
20. 专心唿吸 zhuānxīn hūxī(concentrate on breathing)
21. 循环游泳 xúnhuán yóuyǒng(cycle swimming)
22. 水道的宽度 shuǐdào de kuāndù(channel width)

24. 想像 xiǎngxiàng(imagine)

47. 白费 báifèi(in vain)

item.title: #99. 台湾的行人地狱 Taiwan's "living hell" for pedestrians (Level B1-B2)
item.description:
台湾的行人地狱
生詞 vocabulary
2. 解除规定 jiěchú guīdìng(lift of regulations)
3. 新冠肺炎 xīnguān fèiyán(covid-19 )
4. 行人地狱 xíngrén dìyù (pedestrian hell (referring to chaotic pedestrian traffic))
5. 日常生活 rìcháng shēng huó(daily life)
6. 过马路 guò mǎlù(crossing the road)
